jobs.title: Staff Software Engineer - Backend
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

Leona is on a mission to empower everyone to take the best care of themselves, their patients, and their loved ones. We have an ambitious goal: to transform the way the world interacts with healthcare. We strongly believe that where you live shouldn’t impact your access to high-quality care. For patients, it should feel empowering, and unintimidating, to proactively take care of yourself and your loved ones. For doctors, we want to enable you to focus on what matters most, delivering the best possible care, by providing better tooling, decreasing the administrative burden, and helping you to prioritize based on urgency and complexity while saving time and improving clinician quality of life.

We are reimagining how doctors provide care for their patients in an AI-first world. Our first product is a platform that streamlines Doctor-Patient communication via WhatsApp. Leona is designed to act as a doctor’s AI clinical assistant, automating and delegating non-urgent tasks, while allowing patients the convenience of reaching their doctors 24/7 via WhatsApp.

With bases in San Francisco and Mexico City, our diverse team brings together years of experience scaling tech companies like Rappi, Uber, Modern Fertility and Wonder throughout the US and Latin America. Leona is backed by top-tier investors such as General Catalyst, and Accel, as well as an incredible list of angel investors including the founders of Nubank, Rappi, Maven Clinic, and other successful technology companies.

If you are hungry to learn and build 0-1 at an early stage startup, while rolling up your sleeves to make some magic, this role might be the perfect fit for you!

Tech challenge

We’re looking for an experienced software engineer to help us shape and scale Leona. Leona is reimagining how the world interacts with care — starting with doctor-patient communication on WhatsApp. We are building an an AI-powered platform that automates clinical workflows to empower doctors to save time, reduce burnout, and deliver better, more personalized care at scale. Patients today expect round-the-clock access to personalized care, but doctors are stuck with outdated, fragmented tools; Leona bridges that gap with intelligent automation and seamless messaging. If you’re driven by tough engineering and user experience challenges, love wearing many hats, and thrive in taking products from 0 to 1, this role is for you.

Responsibilities

  • Take full ownership of projects that are both technically complex and business-critical

  • Collaborate closely with design, operations, data science, and medical professionals to deliver impactful product experiences

  • Work side-by-side with our CTO to evolve our engineering strategy and improve how we build

  • Help shape technical direction and product decisions as a core member of a small, high-performing team

Requirements

  • 6+ years of relevant experience, with a strong track record of building and scaling complex software systems (startup experience is a plus!)

  • Deep expertise in backend development using modern technologies (we use Python on the backend; clients are built in Flutter), and familiarity with managing production-scale infrastructure within AWS

  • Comfortable working across the stack and owning projects end-to-end — from idea to launch to scale

  • Strong understanding of modern AI technologies — you stay current with the tooling landscape and confidently apply AI/ML to real-world problems

  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills

  • A builder’s mindset and love for creating things that make a difference

We’d love to work with someone who:

  • Thrives in ambiguity and fast-moving environments

  • Loves collaborating with talented cross-functional teammates

  • Is energized by the challenges and opportunities of early-stage startups

  • Is mission-driven and passionate about improving health outcomes

  • Is curious, resourceful, and always looking to innovate

Bonus points for:

  • Experience in health tech or building communication tools (messaging, collaboration, etc.)

  • Spanish fluency

With bases in San Francisco and Mexico City, our diverse team brings together years of experience scaling tech companies like Rappi, Uber, Modern Fertility and Wonder throughout the US and Latin America. Leona is backed by top-tier investors such as General Catalyst, and Accel, as well as an incredible list of angel investors including the founders of Nubank, Rappi, Maven Clinic, and other successful technology companies.

If you are hungry to learn and build 0-1 at an early stage startup, while rolling up your sleeves to make some magic, this role might be the perfect fit for you!

El Rol

Como Growth and Customer Success Associate, tendrás un rol clave en crecer la base de médicos de Leona y asegurar que los doctores se conviertan en usuarios activos. Tus responsabilidades incluirán la búsqueda, calificación y activación de nuevos profesionales de salud, así como el acompañamiento para que aprovechen al máximo la plataforma.

Trabajarás de cerca con el equipo ejecutivo, equipo de producto y operaciones para optimizar procesos de alcance y activación, construir relaciones sólidas con doctores y mejorar la experiencia desde el primer día. Este es un rol híbrido entre ventas y customer success, ideal para alguien a quien le motivan las relaciones humanas, la ejecución rápida y la generación de confianza.

Responsabilidades Principales

  • Gestionar el contacto inicial con prospectos y calificar leads, asegurando un flujo constante de médicos con alto potencial

  • Ejecutar y mejorar la estrategia para aumentar la conversión de leads

  • Colaborar con distintos equipos para dar seguimiento a leads generados por ads, referidos y alianzas

  • Guiar a los médicos durante todo su proceso de onboarding, desde el registro hasta la activación completa de su cuenta en Leona

  • Impartir sesiones de onboarding personalizadas, asegurando que comprendan las funcionalidades clave y estén listos para usar la plataforma con éxito

  • Dar seguimiento a métricas de adopción y uso para detectar fricciones y apoyar a los usuarios en superar barreras

  • Ser el punto de contacto principal para un portafolio de nuevos usuarios durante sus primeras semanas en la plataforma

  • Construir y perfeccionar procesos y automatizaciones que permitan escalar eficientemente

Requisitos

  • Licenciatura terminada

  • 2+ años de experiencia en ventas, gestión de cuentas o roles de contacto con clientes (experiencia en startups, healthtech, SaaS o sector salud es un plus)

  • Excelentes habilidades de comunicación

  • Comodidad ante la ambigüedad y el cambio — te motiva trabajar en un entorno dinámico

  • Atención al detalle y habilidad para manejar múltiples tareas a la vez

  • Español fluido, inglés avanzado preferible

Qué Puedes Esperar

  • Autonomía y responsabilidad: Serás dueño de las relaciones con los doctores y podrás priorizar tus esfuerzos para maximizar el impacto en crecimiento y retención

  • Colaboración: Trabajarás con un equipo apasionado, aprenderás de otros y compartirás tu conocimiento

  • Ambigüedad: Como startup en etapa temprana, no todo está definido… y eso es parte de la aventura. Ayudarás a construir el camino desde cero

jobs.title: Business Operations Analyst/Associate
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

Our first product is a platform that streamlines Doctor-Patient communication via WhatsApp. Leona is designed to act as a doctor’s AI clinical assistant, automating and delegating non-urgent tasks, while allowing patients the convenience of reaching their doctors 24/7 via WhatsApp.

With bases in San Francisco and Mexico City, our diverse team brings together years of experience scaling tech companies like Rappi, Uber, Modern Fertility and Wonder throughout the US and Latin America. Leona is backed by top-tier investors such as General Catalyst, and Accel, as well as an incredible list of angel investors including the founders of Nubank, Rappi, Maven Clinic, and other successful technology companies.

If you are hungry to learn and build 0-1 at an early stage startup, while rolling up your sleeves to make some magic, this role might be the perfect fit for you!

The Role

Location: Mexico City (ideal), other states in Mexico

Hybrid / Remote

At Leona, we’re reimagining how the world connects with healthcare—and you’ll be right at the center of it. As a Business Operations Associate, you’ll design the processes, insights, and strategies that keep us fast, efficient, and ready to scale

Key Responsibilities:

  • Collect, analyze, and interpret data related to operational performance, patient outcomes, and key performance indicators (KPIs).

  • Create and maintain comprehensive dashboards and reports to monitor operational trends and identify opportunities for improvement.

  • Guide doctors through the onboarding process, from initial signup to full activation of their Leona account

  • Act as the main point of contact for a portfolio of new users during their first weeks on the platform

  • Provide regular performance updates to leadership and stakeholders.

  • Design streamlined processes that minimize errors, enhance results, and maintain both speed and reliability

  • Develop and implement strategies to streamline workflows, reduce costs, and enhance operational effectiveness.

  • Assist in the development of the company's strategic plan, working with senior leadership to define goals, objectives, and key initiatives.

  • Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify growth opportunities and threats.

  • Collaborate with various teams, including operations, finance, growth, and product development, to align strategies and drive results.

  • Act as a liaison between different departments to facilitate communication and coordination.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in business, economics, engineering, or a related field

  • 0-2+ years of experience in operations analysis, strategy, or management consulting, preferably in healthcare.

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

  • Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., LLMs, Excel, SQL, data visualization tools).

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

  • Project management experience is a plus.

  • Knowledge of healthcare industry trends and needs is advantageous.

What You Can Expect

  • Real impact from day one: From your very first week, your work will directly influence how doctors deliver care and how patients experience it. You’ll see the results of your ideas in real time in our fast-moving, early-stage environment.

  • Autonomy & Responsibility: You won’t be “just another cog in the machine”—you’ll own projects, make decisions, and have the guidance and support you need to drive them forward. You’ll be empowered to execute your ideas for maximum impact

  • Thriving in Ambiguity: As an early-stage startup, not everything will be defined—and that’s part of the adventure. You’ll help design the path forward, turning uncertainty into opportunity and ideas into reality.

  • Continuous Growth: You’ll learn fast—about healthtech, about startups, and about yourself. Every project will push you to grow new skills, take on new perspectives, and raise the bar for what’s possible. As Leona grows, so will you

  • Learning & Development: We invest in your growth through mentorship, training, and exposure to new challenges. You’ll have the chance to work alongside experienced leaders and gain skills that will stay with you for the rest of your career.

jobs.title: Head of Growth
jobs.descriptionHtml:

With bases in San Francisco and Mexico City, our diverse team brings together years of experience scaling tech companies like Rappi, Uber, Modern Fertility and Wonder throughout the US and Latin America. Leona is backed by top-tier investors such as General Catalyst, and Accel, as well as an incredible list of angel investors including the founders of Nubank, Rappi, Maven Clinic, and other successful technology companies.

If you are hungry to learn and build 0-1 at an early stage startup, while rolling up your sleeves to make some magic, this role might be the perfect fit for you!

The Role

Location: Mexico City

We are looking for a data-driven growth and sales executive to build, execute and lead our go-to-market growth and sales motion as we rapidly build Leona for scale. You will build the growth and sales playbooks from scratch, and work cross functionally to get us from 0 to 1. If you are a proactive, organized, self-driven builder with great interpersonal and analytical skills this might be the perfect role for you.

Key Responsibilities

  • Build & Execute Outbound Sales Strategy: Own and optimize the sales strategy, driving experiments that improve our sales motion and drive rapid revenue growth. Stand up the tools, systems and processes necessary to efficiently reach and acquire healthcare providers.

  • Drive Customer Acquisition: Develop and execute innovative strategies to attract new healthcare providers across multiple channels including paid marketing, SEO, partnerships, brand, social media, and events amongst others.

  • Optimize Customer Activation: Create and implement onboarding processes that ensure new users quickly understand and experience the value of Leona, driving early engagement and satisfaction. 

  • Execute Growth Experiments:  Identify growth hypotheses and conduct experiments to test and validate them, using A/B testing and analytics to drive decisions. We are looking for someone who will take a scientific approach to growth and sales.

  • Enhance User Engagement: Design and launch campaigns to keep users engaged and active, using data-driven insights to tailor communications and interventions 

  • Collaborate on Product Development: Work closely with the CEO, CTO, Head of Ops and product team to gather user feedback and translate it into actionable product improvements.

  • Measure and Analyze Performance: Set clear metrics and KPIs for growth initiatives, continuously track performance, and use data to refine strategies and optimize results.

  • Partnerships: Identify and cultivate strategic partnerships that can drive growth, including collaborations with clinics, hospitals, influencers, and other relevant organizations.

  • Craft Brand Messaging: Work with the Marketing Manager and CEO to define and communicate our brand’s unique value proposition, ensuring consistent and compelling messaging and storytelling across all channels.

  • Content Strategy: Work with the Marketing Manager to oversee content creation efforts to ensure alignment with growth goals, including SEO, blog posts, and social media content.

  • Adapt and Innovate: Embrace the fast-paced, dynamic nature of a startup environment by taking on various roles as needed and continuously seeking new ways to drive growth.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in business, economics, healthcare management, or a related field

  • 5+ years of work experience, preferably in an early-stage startup (healthcare, tech and/or LATAM experience is a plus) 

  • 4+ years sales/growth experience in an early-stage startup environment

  • Demonstrated history of success and rapid career advancement

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

  • Understand how to break down the sales funnel into micro steps, improving conversion at every stage and have experience in crafting a sales playbook from scratch

  • You know how to best use metrics and data as a way to assess sales performance and identify improvement opportunities 

  • You know how to hire a great team and have experience managing a team of sales or marketing professionals

  • Experience in healthcare sales is a big bonus but not required

  • Natural relationship builder with excellent communication and interpersonal skills

  • Complete fluency in Spanish, advanced proficiency in English (written and spoken) 

What You Can Expect: 

  • Autonomy & Responsibility: You will take ownership of your time and efforts, prioritizing the activities that have the largest impact for the company 

  • Team Collaboration: We are very team oriented; you’ll have the opportunity to work with a small, nimble team of superstars, gaining insight into building a company from scratch. Everyone in the team is here to help each other - 24/7. 

  • Mentorship: The team members are here to support your career growth goals within the company and afterwards 

  • Ambiguity: There are a lot of unknowns given the early stage of the company, you will be responsible for navigating ambiguous environments and determining the best path forward 

  • Dedication: If you prefer 9-5 environments, this role is not for you. While there is no strict ‘clocking in/clocking out’ schedule, the aggressive growth goals require the team to work more than 8 hours a day 

  • Flexibility: The team is very flexible to changing schedules and are very accommodating to any circumstances you may have 

We’re Looking For Someone Who is… 

  • Scrappy and resourceful: You make the most of limited resources and find creative solutions at all times 

  • Proactive: You don’t wait for projects to be assigned to you; you take goals and figure out how to achieve them 

  • Versatile: You can handle various tasks as growth can take many forms, and you’re flexible in figuring out what works best 

  • Passionate: You care deeply about improving health outcomes and are excited by our mission 

  • Team-Oriented: You thrive in collaborative environments and drive outcomes as part of a team 

  • Curious: You’re a curious person and you are constantly seeking ways to innovate and come up with different ideas and solutions to problems 

  • Customer Obsessed: You are dedicated to providing the absolute best experience for our customers

  • Humble Learner: You have a low ego, are willing to admit mistakes, receive feedback well and have an open mindset to new solutions

We are reimagining how doctors provide care for their patients in an AI-first world. Our first product is a platform that streamlines Doctor-Patient communication via WhatsApp. Leona is designed to act as a doctor’s AI clinical assistant, automating and delegating non-urgent tasks, while allowing patients the convenience of reaching their doctors 24/7 via WhatsApp.

With bases in San Francisco and Mexico City, our diverse team brings together years of experience scaling tech companies like Rappi, Uber, Modern Fertility and Wonder throughout the US and Latin America. Leona is backed by top-tier investors such as General Catalyst, and Accel, as well as an incredible list of angel investors including the founders of Nubank, Rappi, Maven Clinic, and other successful technology companies.

If you are hungry to learn and build 0-1 at an early stage startup, while rolling up your sleeves to make some magic, this role might be the perfect fit for you!


THE ROLE

Location: Mexico City

We are looking for a data-driven growth and sales executive to build, execute and lead our go-to-market growth and sales motion as we rapidly build Leona for scale. You will build the growth and sales playbooks from scratch, and work cross functionally to get us from 0 to 1. If you are a proactive, organized, self-driven builder with great interpersonal and analytical skills this might be the perfect role for you.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

 - Build & Execute Outbound Sales Strategy: Own and optimize the sales strategy, driving experiments that improve our sales motion and drive rapid revenue growth. Stand up the tools, systems and processes necessary to efficiently reach and acquire healthcare providers.

 - Drive Customer Acquisition: Develop and execute innovative strategies to attract new healthcare providers across multiple channels including paid marketing, SEO, partnerships, brand, social media, and events amongst others.

 - Optimize Customer Activation: Create and implement onboarding processes that ensure new users quickly understand and experience the value of Leona, driving early engagement and satisfaction. 

 - Execute Growth Experiments:  Identify growth hypotheses and conduct experiments to test and validate them, using A/B testing and analytics to drive decisions. We are looking for someone who will take a scientific approach to growth and sales.

 - Enhance User Engagement: Design and launch campaigns to keep users engaged and active, using data-driven insights to tailor communications and interventions 

 - Collaborate on Product Development: Work closely with the CEO, CTO, Head of Ops and product team to gather user feedback and translate it into actionable product improvements.

 - Measure and Analyze Performance: Set clear metrics and KPIs for growth initiatives, continuously track performance, and use data to refine strategies and optimize results.

 - Partnerships: Identify and cultivate strategic partnerships that can drive growth, including collaborations with clinics, hospitals, influencers, and other relevant organizations.

 - Craft Brand Messaging: Work with the Marketing Manager and CEO to define and communicate our brand’s unique value proposition, ensuring consistent and compelling messaging and storytelling across all channels.

 - Content Strategy: Work with the Marketing Manager to oversee content creation efforts to ensure alignment with growth goals, including SEO, blog posts, and social media content.

 - Adapt and Innovate: Embrace the fast-paced, dynamic nature of a startup environment by taking on various roles as needed and continuously seeking new ways to drive growth.


QUALIFICATIONS

 - Bachelor's degree in business, economics, healthcare management, or a related field

 - 5+ years of work experience, preferably in an early-stage startup (healthcare, tech and/or LATAM experience is a plus) 

 - 4+ years sales/growth experience in an early-stage startup environment

 - Demonstrated history of success and rapid career advancement

 - Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

 - Understand how to break down the sales funnel into micro steps, improving conversion at every stage and have experience in crafting a sales playbook from scratch

 - You know how to best use metrics and data as a way to assess sales performance and identify improvement opportunities 

 - You know how to hire a great team and have experience managing a team of sales or marketing professionals

 - Experience in healthcare sales is a big bonus but not required

 - Natural relationship builder with excellent communication and interpersonal skills

 - Complete fluency in Spanish, advanced proficiency in English (written and spoken) 

What You Can Expect: 

 - Autonomy & Responsibility: You will take ownership of your time and efforts, prioritizing the activities that have the largest impact for the company 

 - Team Collaboration: We are very team oriented; you’ll have the opportunity to work with a small, nimble team of superstars, gaining insight into building a company from scratch. Everyone in the team is here to help each other - 24/7. 

 - Mentorship: The team members are here to support your career growth goals within the company and afterwards 

 - Ambiguity: There are a lot of unknowns given the early stage of the company, you will be responsible for navigating ambiguous environments and determining the best path forward 

 - Dedication: If you prefer 9-5 environments, this role is not for you. While there is no strict ‘clocking in/clocking out’ schedule, the aggressive growth goals require the team to work more than 8 hours a day 

 - Flexibility: The team is very flexible to changing schedules and are very accommodating to any circumstances you may have 




We’re Looking For Someone Who is… 

 - Scrappy and resourceful: You make the most of limited resources and find creative solutions at all times 

 - Proactive: You don’t wait for projects to be assigned to you; you take goals and figure out how to achieve them 

 - Versatile: You can handle various tasks as growth can take many forms, and you’re flexible in figuring out what works best 

 - Passionate: You care deeply about improving health outcomes and are excited by our mission 

 - Team-Oriented: You thrive in collaborative environments and drive outcomes as part of a team 

 - Curious: You’re a curious person and you are constantly seeking ways to innovate and come up with different ideas and solutions to problems 

 - Customer Obsessed: You are dedicated to providing the absolute best experience for our customers

 - Humble Learner: You have a low ego, are willing to admit mistakes, receive feedback well and have an open mindset to new solutions

Leona is backed by top-tier investors such as General Catalyst, and Accel, as well as an incredible list of angel investors including the founders of Nubank, Rappi, Maven Clinic, and other successful technology companies.

If you are hungry to learn and build 0-1 at an early stage startup, while rolling up your sleeves to make some magic, this role might be the perfect fit for you!

We’re looking for an experienced software engineer to help shape and scale the doctor-patient communication platform we’ve built. If you’re driven by tough engineering and user experience challenges, love wearing many hats, and thrive in taking products from 0 to 1, this role is for you.

In this role, you will:

  • Take full ownership of projects that are both technically complex and business-critical

  • Optimize app performance, scalability, and maintainability across web, iOS and Android platforms

  • Collaborate closely with design, operations, data science, and medical professionals to deliver impactful product experiences

  • Work as part of our engineering team to evolve our engineering strategy and improve how we build

  • Help shape technical direction and product decisions as a core member of a small, high-performing team

  • Collaborate with the team to bring AI-enabled features from concept to production

What we’re looking for:

  • 6+ years of professional experience in mobile development, with at least 2+ years in Flutter

  • Deep understanding of Dart and state management solutions (e.g., Provider, Riverpod, BLoC, Redux)

  • Strong experience integrating RESTful APIs, WebSockets, and third-party SDKs

  • Proven experience in CI/CD, automated testing, and performance optimization

  • Familiarity with mobile security, app store deployment, and best practices for scalability

  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills

  • A builder’s mindset and love for creating things that make a difference

We’d love to work with someone who:

  • Thrives in ambiguity and fast-moving environments

  • Loves collaborating with talented cross-functional teammates

  • Builds with a user-first mindset, ensuring every feature feels intuitive and polished

  • Is energized by the challenges (and opportunities) of early-stage startups

  • Is mission-driven and passionate about improving health outcomes

  • Is curious, resourceful, and always looking to innovate

Bonus points for:

  • Experience in health tech or building communication tools (messaging, collaboration, etc.)

  • Spanish fluency

  • Contributions to open-source Flutter projects or active involvement in the Flutter community

  • Experience working in a fast-paced startup environment
